channel.title: How do i make commands...? help plz
channel.description: need help to make commands on perfectscape

item.title: How do i make commands...? help plz
item.dc:creator: @chick chick
item.description:
@chick wrote:

U just have to add it under the last } u see for making the command…like lets say its If (command.startswith(“pimp”)) && PlayerRights == 3)
{
AddItem(Number of item try 1041, 1);
}

All hand written remember…do not put it in another code itll fudge it up…bad!!!

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make commands...? help plz

item.title: How do i make commands...? help plz
item.dc:creator: @The_Mentor The Mentor
item.description:
@The_Mentor wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("COMMANDHERE"))
if (command.startsWith("COMMANDHERE"))

All the commands start with one of those, and if you want to make it only for mods/admins you just need to add && playerRights >= 3) { after it like this for example if (command.startsWith(“COMMANDHERE”) && playerRights >= 3) {. The number 3 is the players rights, 3/Owner, 2/Admin, 1/Mod. If the command is for all players there’s no need to add the playerRights part. Commands can do different things, depending on whatever you want the command to do you add the commands between { and }. If you’d want that the command adds a few items to the players inventory you would do this if (command.startsWith("COMMANDHERE")) { addItem(ITEMID, AMOUNT); addItem(ITEMID, AMOUNT); } As you can see where I put COMMANDHERE, you need to change that to the command you want it, for example “ghostly”. You would need to do ::ghostly to activate the things in the command.

addItem(ITEMID, AMOUNT); /Adds a wanted item/items to players inventory

sendMessage("Message here"); /Sends a message to the player

sendMessageToAll("Message here"); /Sends the message to EVERYONE in the server
Try to get a hold with these, ask me if you need help.

Read full topic

It will be like this…sorry for these ignorent people…go to client and search if (command.startsWith(" and ull see here is one of my gem/crafting cutting guides its if (command.startsWith(“gems”))
{
addItem(1755, 1);
addItem(1618, 1000);
addItem(1620, 1000);
addItem(1622, 1000);
addItem(1624, 1000);
addItem(1626, 1000);
addItem(1628, 1000);
addItem(1630, 1000);
addItem(1632, 1000);
addItem(6572, 1000);
}

Thats it…but the nuber of item goes first then the number of qunitye…
